column4: Hi, I installed Windows 7 and I gave 100 gB for Linux Ubuntu installation, but now I just boot Linux Ubuntu and when I am going to make the partition it only show me the entire HD without the NTFS and free partitions, why? help please
how big is the disk?
maybe boot live cd and run gpart frorm a console, see if ubuntu sees partitions at all
gpart scans disks for partitions. that win7 isnt encrypted?
nuh-uh! gpart! not gparted. well, actually, gparted is worth a shot, too, come to think of it
sound like the partition table is somewhat odd.. or the disk layout. but 300gb, thats a laptop disk, no ssd, right?
is a PC
with 300gb disk? raided a antique store? ;)
tough luck. fscking with the part table will make win7 unhappy, my guess
I did the partitions with Windpws 7 installation DVD, so I dont understand why happen this, Windows 7 boots OK
What can I do
Why happened this?
weeeeell: before you mess with the table, back it up: grab a usb stick, do:   dd if=/dev/sda of=/path(to/stick/mbr.backup bs=512 count=1
I dont want to do anything

then try and repair it, install linux, then see if you're lucky and grub boots that win7 or if ms is smart enough meanwhile to handle resintalling botched boot loaders. whcih I doubt, since they are a dork company.
But I cant install linux
well, backup mbr from live cd and then fix it from live cd, too. then when the table is readable to linux, install linux
any manual for mbr fix?
journalist? get a macbook ;)
I dont want to use any apple software any more
outta ideas. I'd try and run google with "gpt win7" or so. my win7 here was ok, same procedure, then again, who knows, maybe I saw sth and overrode it. (overrode? sounds odd)
cfhowlett seems to knwo thing and I need to run. godspeed :D
